title: HTML Injection with XSS possible

profile.name: Imgur
profile.about: The most awesome images on the Internet.

vulnerability_information:
Hi, I found HTML Injection on imgur.com 

Description:
I couldn't get xss but i was able to include videos on my profile and also i was able to redirect users to malicious websites

POC (HTML injection):
go to https://12test.imgur.com (you don't need to login) and you will see external videos and you will see image click on it and you will redirect to http://evil.com,
note that this test page attacker page could be more normal to user,
remeber that it's stored so it will show up when any user viste profile

Suggested fix:
Sanitize all input fields on this page.

## Impact

attacker could redirect users and then execute xss and control them easily, also could include his videos to get views

activities.message: Hi, I was able to bypass waf xss filter and convert html injection to get stored xss Steps to produce: =========== 1- login to your account 2- Create album with name #">XSS 3- open https://[username].imgur.com and click on XSS and javascript will be executed ##POC: victim don't need to login, also i can do something more to be more normal like this: ```html #">

I tried to get xss without user interaction
##Payload:
```Html
"/><svg/on<script>load=prompt(document.domain);>"/><svg/on<script>load=prompt(document.cookie);>
```
You can check this on my profile http://12test.imgur.com/
We have accepted the report as valid and added an issue in our internal issue tracker for your report. We will update this page when more progress is made. Thanks!
any update?!
If may i ask, Do i get reputation if i reported Open Redirect vulnerability ?

Hi @malek,

Open redirect issues are normally out of scope, so I would refrain from reporting those issues. It will most likely end up as a duplicate.

Thank you!

Gratz @malek for finding first.

My $0.02
* This can be wormed.
* The `Imgur.Environment.msid` can be used to CSRF the main site, bypassing SOP and CSP.
* The vulnerability is in the `addAlbumToContainer` function inside `https://s.imgur.com/min/album.js`. The values `a.title` and `a.description` need to be sanitized before being added to the HTML string.
The Imgur team really appreciates your report and would like to give you a monetary bounty. Thanks for taking the time to report this issue and please let us know if you come upon more issues!

Thanks @imgur
It was great to work with you

any update with this report...??

HTML Injection already running

@ttoko any update? Your team should considering updating a and closing such reports. I filed a similar issue for another stored XSS as well as this one that was also a duplicate because reports have been open for so long.
@imgur any update ?!!
I think its alredy fixed
The vulnerability seems to still be there.
^ Correct. There is filtering, but it is still possible to break out of context. Also, from my lastest tests some HTML tags still work for HTML modification.
Its still working
@ttoko do u mind closing this report?
Hi @ttoko, do you mind to close this report ? since you already closed a report bypass the filter after you fix this vulnerability which is #484434.
Hi @Imgur @ttoko @srinidhik, it seems that the issue isn't reproducible anymore, can we mark this as resolved?

Hi @malek,
Yes, this seems to have been resolved. Apologies for the delay; will go
ahead and close this report.

Thanks for helping make Imgur more secure!
